bill_title: Honoring Lydia Farber of Bruce as South Dakota's 2004 Top High School Youth Volunteer.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Lydia Farber of Bruce as South Dakota's 2004 Top High School Youth Volunteer. WHEREAS, Lydia Farber, a resident of Bruce and a student at Sioux Valley High School, has achieved national recognition for exemplary volunteer service by receiving a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award; and WHEREAS, this prestigious award, presented by Prudential Financial in partnership with the National Association of Secondary School Principals, honors young volunteers across America who have demonstrated an extraordinary commitment to serving their communities; and WHEREAS, Ms. Farber earned this award by giving generously of her time to establish a community-wide traffic safety program that promotes sober driving, seatbelt use, and other safety measures to adults, teenagers, and children, which has reached hundreds of students and thousands of others in eastern South Dakota: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Lydia Farber of Bruce, South Dakota, be congratulated on her selection as the 2004 Top High School Youth Volunteer of South Dakota and be thanked for her time and efforts to promote the safety and well being of her fellow South Dakotans.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Lydia Farber of Bruce as South Dakota's 2004 Top High School Youth Volunteer. WHEREAS, Lydia Farber, a resident of Bruce and a student at Sioux Valley High School, has achieved national recognition for exemplary volunteer service by receiving a 2004 Prudential Spirit of Community Award; and WHEREAS, this prestigious award, presented by Prudential Financial in partnership with the National Association of Secondary School Principals, honors young volunteers across America who have demonstrated an extraordinary commitment to serving their communities; and WHEREAS, Ms. Farber earned this award by giving generously of her time to establish a community-wide traffic safety program that promotes sober driving, seatbelt use, and other safety measures to adults, teenagers, and children, which has reached hundreds of students and thousands of others in eastern South Dakota: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Lydia Farber of Bruce, South Dakota, be congratulated on her selection as the 2004 Top High School Youth Volunteer of South Dakota and be thanked for her time and efforts to promote the safety and well being of her fellow South Dakotans.
